text: pulmonary valve 7.5% Asymmetric growth 7.5% Facial asymmetry 7.5% Pectus excavatum 7.5% Ptosis 7.5% Hearing impairment - High palate - Low-set ears - Protruding ear - Pulmonic stenosis - Specific learning disability - X-linked inheritance - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually listed as a rough
